This custom 300 Win Mag rifle was designed & built by an Indiana gunsmith.  The rifle is built around a beautiful Remington 1917 bulletproof Mauser-style action.  The barrel is a 308 Norma Magnum barrel hand-fitted and head-spaced to the Remington action.  
The barrel and action have been fitted to a beautiful custom walnut stock.  See pics.
The action is drilled & tapped for scope and a nice set of Williams iron sights have also been installed.  I would grade the gun at 85-90% 

I originally bought the gun to give to my father to take on an elk hunting trip.  My father passed before the trip and am ready to move on to something else.

The gun is not "mint"; but I am not asking a "mint price" either.  I would grade the rifle at 85-90%.  

Asking $250.

Pretty sure the action is worth over half of what i am asking, so please no crazy offers.

title: For Sale:  French Fusil MAS Mle 1936
location: South East Virginnia, Virginia, United States
postcontent:
NOTE: it is the buyers responsibility to confirm that this firearm is legal to own in your state and/or locality.

Offered for your consideration is one (1) French Fusil MAS Mle 1936 chambered in the French 7.5X54m/m caliber. Prior to the adoption of the Fusil MAS Mle 1936 the primary French battle rifles were the Berthier and the problematic, and expensive, Mle 1886. Both of these rifles were chambered for the 8X50m/m Lebel cartridge. 
After the Great War, (World War I), the French sought to develop a new, and more powerful, cartridge and newer weapons to fire them. As a result, the Fusil MAS Mle 1936 became the standard battle rifle in 1936 and continued this role until 1956 when it was withdrawn from service, except for those designed for sniping. It was arguably the easiest to maintain weapon of its type. Like the British Enfield, it was a good enough design to survive into the beginning of the automatic rifle era and was popular with its users both as a rifle, and as a platform for launching grenades.
The script “L” prefix to the serial number indicates that this rifle was manufactured between 1945 and 1946. All serial numbers, with the exception of the bayonet, are matching. The bore is bright & shiny with strong lands & grooves and shows no signs of excessive wear or corrosion. It comes with the standard 13 inch spike bayonet which is stored in a tube under the barrel when not in use. There is a very tiny importer mark on the bottom of the barrel, near the muzzle. One has to look hard to see it. This Fusil MAS Mle 1936 is in great overall condition and would make an excellent addition to a collection of military small arms, and a fun rifle to shoot. Ammunition is available on the surplus market and from a few ammunition manufacturers. Additional Pictures upon request.

Product Information: 
• Action: Bolt. 
• Metal Finish: Black paint. 
• Caliber/Gauge: 7.5X54m/m French. 
• Serial Number: L43***. 
• Bore: Bright & shiny with strong lands & grooves. 
• Barrel Length: 23 Inches. 
• Grip/Stock: Solid with no cracks, splits or missing wood. 
• Features: Adjustable rear sight; 13 inch spike bayonet. 
• Extras: None.
• Estimated NRA Modern Condition: NRA Very Good+.
• Blemishes: A few minor handling marks on the stock and small amount of finish loss to the metal.
• Parts Not Present: None. 
• Parts Broken: None. 

NOTE: Foxfire Rod & Gun only checks firearms for proper operation in an unloaded mode using inert rounds. We do not test fire them using live ammunition.

PAYMENT:
I only accept the three following types of payment.
1) United States Postal Money Orders Only. (Preferred)
2) Certified Funds with issuer’s contact information, including phone number(s).
3) Personal / Business checks with bank contact information, including phone number(s). Item shipped when check clears. 

Foxfire Rod & Gun does not accept any type of credit/debit cards, Pay Pal, or any other form of electronic payment.

Please make payments payable to Foxfire Rod & Gun.
Payment must be received within 10 days.

Mail To:
Foxfire Rod & Gun
P.O. Box 104
Carson, Virginia 23830-0104

Phone = 804-862-4310
FAX = 804-862-4311

SHIPPING: 
FEE: $25.00

Handguns & Non-Gun Items: USPS Priority Mail. The proper insurance, Delivery Confirmation, and Return Receipt are required. The fees for these items are including in the shipping charge quoted above.

Long Guns: FedEx Ground and insured for sale price.

NOTE: Foxfire Rod & Gun does not provide for customer pick up. All items must be shipped.

RETURN POLICY:
Non-Gun Merchandise: You have a 3 day inspection period beginning at the time your item(s) arrive at your requested shipping address.

Modern, Curio / Relic, Antique Firearms: YOU HAVE A 3 DAY INSPECTION PERIOD BEGINNING AT THE TIME THAT YOUR MERCHANDISE ARRIVES EITHER AT YOUR MAILING ADDRESS, OR IN THE CASE OF A MODERN OR CURIO / RELIC FIREARM, AT YOUR FFL DEALER'S MAILING ADDRESS. During this period the firearm is not to be fired or disassembled in any fashion. If you choose to return the item, it MUST be received by Foxfire Rod & Gun in the EXACT and SAME condition as you received it. Unless the item was misrepresented in the ad description, all shipping charges are non-refundable and I will refund the purchase price of the item ONLY.

LARGE MAGAZINE RESTRICTIONS:
New Jersey: 5 round maximum for semi-automatic firearms only.
California: 10 round maximum for all magazines.
Maryland: 20 round maximum for all magazines. (Except .22 rimfire tubular magazines)
Massachusetts: 10 round maximum all magazines.
Hawaii: 10 round maximum for all handgun magazines.
California: 10 round maximum all magazines.

postcontent:
NOTE: it is the buyers responsibility to confirm that this firearm is legal to own in your state and/or locality.

Offered for your consideration is one (1) New Haven 250C semi-automatic .22 caliber rifle. The New Haven brand was manufactured by O.F. Mossberg & Sons as their economy line of rifles and is the same basic rifle as the Mossberg 350KA. 
The New Haven brand of rifles mainly differed from the Mossberg branded rifles due to the lack of some embellishments such as having plain walnut stained hardwood stocks rather than the high grade checkered Monte Carlo stocks. There were also other cost saving options used such as sights which were not quite a costly to produce as the ones used on the Mossberg branded rifles. However, the main components, such as the barrels, firing group, etc. were the same quality as the ones used in the main line of the Mossberg branded rifles.
This New Haven Mossberg is complete and feeds, fires, and ejects properly. It will make an excellent choice for a beginning shooter, as well as an excellent utility rifle. Additional pictures upon request.

title: For Sale:  ST 9" Side Loading Havoc Launcher and KAOS Stock
postcontent:
The ST 9" Side Loading Flare Launcher features the latest in design and manufacturing technology. Parts are CAD designed and CNC machined from solid billet material rather than the typical stamped and welded construction of other launchers. The 6061 and 7075 Aircraft grade aluminum components are anodized in Type III Hardcoat black for maximum durability and ease of maintenance. 

Additional components are built from 1018 cold rolled steel and plated with a Mil-spec black oxide finish. The proprietary STZ push button cylindrical breech lock design is 3 times stronger than existing lever lock systems. The Havoc is designed to mount on any Mil-Spec rail system. Installation simply requires sliding the launcher onto the bottom rail of the handguard and tightening two set screws which are included. 


Features

Side-swivel Breach Loading Design
Push-button Breach Lock
One-piece Tube & Grip
Supports 5 3/4" USCG Munitions

Materials 
Raw Material: 6061 Billet Body, 7075 Aluminum Tube
Processing: CNC Machined
Coating: Mil-spec Type III Black Hardcoat

Dimensions 
Length: 9.0"
Width: 2.75"
Height: 4-1/8"
Weight: 2.30lbs

The Kaos Stock System series allows you to take your existing rail mounted Havoc launcher and turn it into a stand-alone weapon system. It is compatible with most aftermarket AR-15 stocks, latch plates, & pistol grips. 


Features

Mil-spec A2 Pistol Grip
Mil-spec 1913 Picatinny Top Rail
Mil-spec Buffer Tube, Latch Plate, & Castle Nut
ST M4 Stock
Compatible with 9" Rail Mounted Havoc Launchers

title: For Sale/Trade:  Handforged One-of-a-Kind Large Bowie by Joseph Wright
location: SW 83rd and May, Oklahoma City, Oklahoma
postcontent: There is only one of these in existence.  I know because I made it.  This knife is about 16" in length with a 10" blade handforged from new American made 5160 tool steel and selectively hardened.  The blade is 1/4" thick at the ricasso and perfectly tapered.  The handle is a stout piece of elk horn.  The gaurd and butt-plate are cut from the same stock as the blade.  The tang is a full 3/4" by 1/4" all the way through the handle and forged down solid at the pommel.  The knife is decorated with unique filework and lightly acid etched with my maker's mark.  This is my first knife for sale with the Incan Cross emblem and is numbered 001, with my initials and place of manufacture Okc USA.

title: For Sale/Trade:  .9mm Stripper Clips For Sale or Trade
location: Rogers, Bentonville, Springdale, Fayetteville, Fayetteville, Arkansas
postcontent: Forty (40) 8 round military stripper clips. Photo is a sample of the condition of these lots. They are parkerized or shiny steel with a bit of storage rust here and there but otherwise in great shape with strong springs. These were made for a 9mm Czech subgun back in the 1950's which was supplied to the Korean War, Vietnam War, Israeli conflicts, etc. But they will hold 9mm Luger, 7.62 Tokarev, 7.63 Mauser, 30 Carbine, and other calibers as well. With some modification, people say they have used them to load old broomhandle Mausers. Almost impossible to find especially in this condition. $25.00 or trade for 2 (50) round boxes of .9mm Luger ammo, brass only, no reloads. Located in Rogers.

Brand New!


KSG

 TECHNICAL SPECS
Caliber :	12 gauge 3”
Barrel length :	18.5"
Total capacity :	6+6+1
Weight empty :	6.9lbs
Weight loaded :	8.5lbs
Length :  26.1"
Height :  7"


 DESCRIPTION
This simple and reliable pump action feeds from either the left or right tube. The feed side is manually selected by a lever located behind the trigger guard.

The pump includes an under picatinny rail for the mounting of a forward grip, a light, or a laser. The included top picatinny sight rail will accept many types of optics or iron sights. Forward and rear sling loops are built in, and a basic sling is included. The soft rubber butt pad helps to tame recoil.

The KSG receiver is made from hardened steel and includes the magazine tubes which have been welded in place. The grip and stock assembly is made of glass reinforced nylon (Zytel) and is easily disassembled by pushing out 2 pins, which store in 2 holes in the grip when removed. The barrel and pump assembly is removed by loosening the 2 front magazine tube nuts with a coin and sliding the assembly forward.



No trades please.

FS Sig P224 SAS Gen 2 40S&W Night Sights, SRT $650 Madison, AL

I am Selling my Sig Sauer P224 SAS 40S&W. This is an ideal concealed carry weapon. Essentially, the P224 was designed as a scaled down version of the full size Sig P229, one of Sig's most popular guns. 

This version of the P224 is the SAS Edition, which stands for "Sig Anti Snag" meaning that the edges are all slightly rounded off, reducing the incidence of snagging when upholstering your Pistol in a hurry. title: For Sale:  Custom AK-47 - Brand New Polish AK, built to your order!
postcontent:
I have two of these rifles that I would be willing to part with, both are in bone stock form right now, Polish AKM 7.62x39 AK, unfired and new in box, and I would be willing to sell as is for $590 each, or $1000 for both.  These are new unfired rifles.  If you prefer, the following upgrades can be made to customize the rifle to its new owner's preference.  

STAGE I-III MAY BE PURCHSED WITH 700rd SEALED CAN OF 7.62 AMMO FOR AN ADDITIONAL $240...

STAGE IV BUYERS CAN ADD THE 700rd SEALED AMMO CAN OF 7.62 ON FOR $190!!!!

Feel free to message with specific requests, but the basic offerings are:

***
Stage I (as is):   $590
***
INCLUDES:
Polish AK-47 (AKM) 7.62x39mm, black composite foregrip, pistol grip, bayonet lug, muzzle brake, and 30 round magazine.  New and Unfired.
****
STAGE II UPGRADE :$790
***
INCLUDES:

-All Stage I Modifications or Installations

-Strip and clean gun, degrease, oil all internals and apply protectant to forend, grip, and buttstock.

-Grind/polish to smooth all burred metal in receiver, smooth and polish feed ramp and chamber to prevent jams from quality control issues at the factory, smooth and shape mag wells to address pinched mags or awkward loading issues.

-Mount T6 multi-position adjustable butt stock, OR Tapco folding stock. Buyers choice.

-Replace factory grip with Hogue Overmolded handgrip for AK.  Buyer may choose other brand or style of grip if they have a preference, cost will be adjusted accordingly, but Hogue is certainly the industry leader in ergonomics for firearms.

-Replace factory trigger group with Tapco G2 USA made high performance trigger.  Improves trigger feel, control, and eliminates the painful "trigger slap" common in cheaper AK variants.  **REQUIRED FOR STANDALONE SLIDEFIRE RIFLE UPGRADE**

-Install Tapco USA made retaining plate with trigger assembly.
***
STAGE III UPGRADE: $1,190
***
INCLUDES:

- All Stage II parts and modifications.

- Tantal or Russian style steel, miltary grade folding buttstock

- Tactical quadrail forend with 12, 3, 6, and 9 o'clock picatinny rail system, Black

- Adjustable Red/Green holographic sight with variable recticle

-Hogue Overmolded foregrip, Magpul short foregrip OR Magpul AFG Angled foregrip - Buyers Choice!

- Tactical scope mount rail, floats over receiver dustcover using factory scope rail mount.
***
Stage IV Upgrade - $1,240.00 TOTAL 
***
INCLUDES:

Includes all stage II and III modifications and installations, but comes with a SlideFire brand SSAK tactical fire buttstock/handgrip assembly installed in place of the buttstock and grip selected.  If you don't know what this product is, you need to Google or YouTube it - just look up "Slidefire AK Video".  This product allows true select fire of the rifle using the same principle as bump firing, allowing a rate of fire to nearly match a fully automatic AK, while allowing accurate, controlled fire from the shoulder.  If you want to make 20-75 rounds of 7.62 ammo disappear very quickly, this is what you have been looking for!! Totally legal, comes with a letter from the BATF stating as such, but it may as well be an automatic for rate of fire and accuracy... quite a product!!

LOOK HERE FOR SLIDEFIRE VIDEO!!! 
---->   https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=xFVUQru2THo

title: For Sale:  Pre WWII SMI 928 6.5mm Ammo and Clip
postcontent:
To the best of my knowledge this clip and ammo fits a Model 1891 6.5mm Mannlicher-Carcano rifle.  The clip is not a stripper clip, it is inserted into the magazine and is required for the rifle to
function as a repeater. The empty clip is pushed out the bottom of the magazine when
fresh clip is inserted. The brass en-block clips were pre 1938. SMI stands for Society Metallurgical Italian and I think the 28 is the year it was produced. Steel clips were produced after 1938. Both clips work with the 6.5 and 7.35 rounds.  It comes with 6 rounds and the marking s on the rounds are “SMI” and “928”.  I do accept PayPal and will ship.
